Sequence Information.Target Organism: No MICs found in DRAMP database
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Induces the lysis of other B. subtilis cells that have not entered the sporulation pathway, providing a source of nutrients to support sporulation. Can also inhibit growth of other bacteria at high concentrations. Has a role in protecting the secreted lipase LipA against proteolysis, either by modulating its folding or by acting as a protease inhibitor.
Sequence Information.Induction: By Spo0A and PhoP, during nutrient starvation, especially phosphate starvation. Repressed by AbrB during normal growth when nutrients are plentiful, in association with the transcriptional repressor Abh.

Literature.Title: Cannibalism by sporulating bacteria.
Literature.Author: González-Pastor JE, Hobbs EC, Losick R.

Literature.Title: Genes involved in SkfA killing factor production protect a Bacillus subtilis lipase against proteolysis.
Literature.Author: Westers H, Braun PG, Westers L, Antelmann H, Hecker M, Jongbloed JD, Yoshikawa H, Tanaka T, van Dijl JM, Quax WJ.

Literature.Title: Phosphate starvation induces the sporulation killing factor of Bacillus subtilis.
Literature.Author: Allenby NE, Watts CA, Homuth G, Prágai Z, Wipat A, Ward AC, Harwood CR.
